commands

Class PlayerCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • commands.PlayerCommand
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CellCharCommand, CellLowerCommand, CellRaiseCommand, ClearAllCommand, ClearCellCommand, GoHereCommand, PauseCommand, RepeatButtonCommand, RepeatCommand, ResetButtonCommand, SetPinsCommand, SetStringCommand, SetVoiceCommand, SkipButtonCommand, SkipCommand, SoundCommand, TTSCommand, UserInputCommand

    public abstract class PlayerCommand
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class which represents commands that may be issued to the Player. All commands must implement this interface. The behavior of the commands (specifically their serialization) is defined by the appropriate section of the Player documentation
    Since:
    2017-04-01
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dilshad Khatri, Alvis Koshy, Drew Noel, Jonathan Tung

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • serialize

        public abstract java.lang.String serialize()
        Serialize the command into a format that can be written to file, and later read into the player.
        Returns:
        String representation of the current command

      • getEditLabel

        public abstract java.lang.String getEditLabel()
        Get a short prompt for the value of the command. Used when editing a command on the command line
        Returns:
        Short string describing what the authoring user should enter

      • getCurrentValue

        public abstract java.lang.String getCurrentValue()
        Obtain the current internal representation (if any extra exists). Used for most implementing classes to return argument information.
        Returns:
        String consisting of any internal information required

      • setCurrentValue

        public abstract void setCurrentValue(java.lang.String newValue)
        Set the internal extra information for the command. For many classes this is the required argument information.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value of the representation that the command should take.
